info.headline: Typhoon Warning issued October 10 at 3:20PM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...BOLAVEN UPGRADED TO TYPHOON... .NEW INFORMATION... Bolaven`s maximum sustained winds have increased to 80 mph, making Bolaven a typhoon. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Rota, Tinian and Saipan. A Tropical Storm Warning and a Typhoon Watch continues for Guam. A Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. .STORM INFORMATION... At 3 PM ChST, the center of Typhoon Bolaven (15W) was located near LATITUDE 14.2N and LONGITUDE 145.6E. This was about 30 miles east of Rota. Storm motion was west-northwest at 8 mph. Storm intensity was 80 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Bolaven has strengthened into a typhoon with maximum sustained winds of 80 mph. Bolaven is on final approach of the Marianas and will pass over to just north of Rota late this afternoon or early evening. Bolaven will push off to the northwest of the Marianas late tonight with wind decreasing by tomorrow morning. Heavy to torrential rainfall has fallen over Rota and Guam. Heavy rainfall expected and flash flooding possible for Guam and the CNMI through tonight. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Bolaven is making its final approach and all preparations should be complete. Stay inside and only evacuate if directed to do so by local officials, or if your home is vulnerable to high winds or flooding. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. For interests at ports, docks and marinas, preparations should be complete. If you live on a boat, secure your craft before leaving it. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information, please refer to detailed recommendations from your local emergency management agencies. && .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 9 PM ChST or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Warning remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Bolaven is making its final approach and all preparations should be complete. For your safety, stay indoors until the worst of the storm has passed and only evacuate if directed to do so by local officials, or if your home is vulnerable to high winds or flooding. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. Guard against being stuck out on roadways when dangerous winds and heavy rains arrive. Again, do not stay in a corrugated roof home. Remember, pets are not allowed in most official shelters, so check ahead with your intended shelter. If staying in a home, turn the refrigerator to maximum cold and keep it closed. Turn off propane tanks and unplug small appliances. Fill the bathtub with water in case the tap water becomes unavailable after the storm. This is for cleaning and flushing purposes. Do not drink it. && ...TIMING AND PROBABILITY OF TROPICAL STORM/TYPHOON CONDITIONS... Typhoon conditions possible through tonight. The probability of typhoon force winds is 60 to 80 percent for Tinian and Saipan and 80 to 100 percent for Rota. Winds expected to fall below Tropical Storm force by Wednesday afternoon. ...WIND INFORMATION... For Rota, maximum winds are forecast to be 80 to 90 mph from variable directions with gusts to 120 through this evening, backing to the south-southeast 50 and 70 mph with gusts to 90 mph after midnight. A general concern should be for the possibility of moderate to major damage somewhere within the area. For Tinian and Saipan, maximum winds are forecast to be 75 to 80 mph from the east to southeast with gusts to 90 mph through tonight. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least moderate damage somewhere within the area. Winds will decrease tomorrow and become south to southwest 30 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph for Rota, Tinian and Saipan. Poorly-anchored homes with corrugated roofs may be destroyed, along with those of old or poor construction. Some homes of frame construction could sustain partial wall and roof failure, and possibly blown-out windows. Loose outdoor items will become projectiles, causing additional damage and possible injury. Many areas will experience power outages with some downed power poles. Numerous large branches of healthy trees will snap. Some trees will be uprooted, especially where the ground is saturated. ...COASTAL INUNDATION AND SURF INFORMATION... Inundation of up to 7 feet is possible as Bolaven passes nearby, especially during high tide around 6 PM this evening. Dangerous surf conditions with surf heights exceeding 15 feet expected through tomorrow. Hazardous surf conditions expected to continue through at least Thursday. ...INLAND FLOODING... A Flash Flood Watch is in effect for the entire area. Eight to 14 inches of rainfall expected, with locally higher amounts up to 20 inches possible. The highest amounts expected for Rota due to the proximity of Bolaven eyewall. See the latest forecasts for the most up-to-date information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location, and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Soils are already wet from previous rainfall, so it won`t take much to cause flooding.
